HDG.IM.content: Nietzsche: highest concepts, Being, final wisp of evaporating reality [Twilight of the Idols]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: Nietzsche: highest concepts, Being, final wisp of evaporating reality [Twilight of the Idols]

HDG.IM.content: acc. Heidegger, Nietzsche’s wispy Being the guiding conception of Being since early days of his philosophical labor: supports/determines his philosophy from ground up [isn’t that your bias?]

HDG.IM.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Nietzsche’s wispy Being the guiding conception of Being since early days of his philosophical labor: supports/determines his philosophy from ground up [isn’t that your bias?]

HDG.BC.content: assume the simple attitude (Haltung) that matures [reif zu machen] us for such reflection: suffices for this suggestion to distinguish what humanity, having come to itself, must attend to [why we must attend to ground concepts]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: assume the simple attitude (Haltung) that matures [reif zu machen] us for such reflection: suffices for this suggestion to distinguish what humanity, having come to itself, must attend to [why we must attend to ground concepts]

HDG.BC.content: Being withholds itself from any grasping on basis of beings, denies itself every concept, every determination, illumination, in every respect for every attempt at an explanation [what about every name???]: thus Being withholds itself, withdraws: self-concealment belongs to being: Being itself “is” concealment ——Being is the most worn-out (Abgegriffenste) > [beings as testimony to Being] lay claim to Being whenever we experience beings > Being expended (in a way) in constant/multiple use in all relation to beings, but Being not used up in expenditure, remains constantly available to us [cf. Open Manifest]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being withholds itself from any grasping on basis of beings, denies itself every concept, every determination, illumination, in every respect for every attempt at an explanation [what about every name???]: thus Being withholds itself, withdraws: self-concealment belongs to being: Being itself “is” concealment ——Being is the most worn-out (Abgegriffenste) > [beings as testimony to Being] lay claim to Being whenever we experience beings > Being expended (in a way) in constant/multiple use in all relation to beings, but Being not used up in expenditure, remains constantly available to us [cf. Open Manifest]

HDG.BT.content: dubious to invoke self-evidence re: concept of Being
HDG.BT.linkedContent: dubious to invoke self-evidence re: concept of Being

HDG.BT.content: Heidegger asks whether there’s a manifest circularity in method that will ask about Being by asking Dasein, the entity each of us is himself > no, he replies, factically there is no circle, one can determine nature of entities in their Being w/out explicit concept of meaning of Being at one’s disposal
HDG.BT.linkedContent: Heidegger asks whether there’s a manifest circularity in method that will ask about Being by asking Dasein, the entity each of us is himself > no, he replies, factically there is no circle, one can determine nature of entities in their Being w/out explicit concept of meaning of Being at one’s disposal

HDG.BT.content: [causa sui] res cogitans as ens creatum; God, ens infinitum, as ens increatum > createdness (Geschaffenheit) as something’s having been produced (Hergestelltheit): essential to ancient conception of Being

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.BT.linkedContent: [causa sui] res cogitans as ens creatum; God, ens infinitum, as ens increatum > createdness (Geschaffenheit) as something’s having been produced (Hergestelltheit): essential to ancient conception of Being

HDG.WM.content: a history of nothing: from Greek [?] ex nihilo nihil fit (from nothing, nothing comes to be) to Christian dogma ex nihilo fit—ens creatum (from nothing comes—created being) (nothing indicates fundamental conception of beings [here, as counterconcept to summum ens, God as ens increatum?]) > God & nothing [Augustine]

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.WM.linkedContent: a history of nothing: from Greek [?] ex nihilo nihil fit (from nothing, nothing comes to be) to Christian dogma ex nihilo fit—ens creatum (from nothing comes—created being) (nothing indicates fundamental conception of beings [here, as counterconcept to summum ens, God as ens increatum?]) > God & nothing [Augustine]

HDG.QB.content: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

HDG.QB.linkedContent: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]

HDG.QB.content: to connect “work” & “pain”: think fundamental trait of Hegel’s metaphysics: “absolute negativity” as “infinite force” of actuality, i.e., of the “existing concept” > work & pain manifest their innermost metaphysical relatedness in same (not identical) belonging to negation of negation
HDG.QB.linkedContent: to connect “work” & “pain”: think fundamental trait of Hegel’s metaphysics: “absolute negativity” as “infinite force” of actuality, i.e., of the “existing concept” > work & pain manifest their innermost metaphysical relatedness in same (not identical) belonging to negation of negation

HDG.QB.content: algos (pain) related to alegō, the intensivum of legō, means intimate gathering: pain as that which gathers most intimately: Hegel’s concept of “concept,” “strenuous effort” it entails
HDG.QB.linkedContent: algos (pain) related to alegō, the intensivum of legō, means intimate gathering: pain as that which gathers most intimately: Hegel’s concept of “concept,” “strenuous effort” it entails

HDG.FS.content: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation
HDG.FS.linkedContent: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation

HDG.FS.content: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.FS.linkedContent: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]

HDG.FS.content: for Hölderlin, to name is to call (Rufen), not to make a proposition > [unpoetic nature of Greek interpretation of language exposed, no higher poetry than in Greece!] > conception of saying (Sagens) as proposition (Aussagen) prevents access to essence of poetry

HDG.FS.content: thinking Ereignis w/ concepts of Being, history of Being, won’t be successful, nor w/ assistance of the Greek (something “to go beyond” [Nietzsche on Socrates]) > Mit dem Sein verschwindet auch die ontologische Differenz [w/ Being, ontological difference vanishes: i.e. Ereignis goes beyond both?]: ontological difference (1927-1936) a necessary impasse (Holzweg)

HDG.FS.content: Husserl attempts to articulate what Kant simply characterizes as concept of form: thus the given (Gegebenen) of intuition, categorial intuition, category more than a form > categorial as given

motif.name: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

HDG.FS.linkedContent: Husserl attempts to articulate what Kant simply characterizes as concept of form: thus the given (Gegebenen) of intuition, categorial intuition, category more than a form > categorial as given

HDG.FS.content: to unfold question of meaning of Being, Being must be given > Husserl succeeded in this making present of Being, phenomenally present in category > Husserl gave Heidegger ground: “being” no mere concept, no pure abstraction > Husserl doesn’t inquire forth into Being after reaching Being as given, doesn’t ask what it means > no question for Husserl, “being” means being-object (but objectivity is a mode of presence)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: to unfold question of meaning of Being, Being must be given > Husserl succeeded in this making present of Being, phenomenally present in category > Husserl gave Heidegger ground: “being” no mere concept, no pure abstraction > Husserl doesn’t inquire forth into Being after reaching Being as given, doesn’t ask what it means > no question for Husserl, “being” means being-object (but objectivity is a mode of presence)

HDG.FS.content: the thinking here [Greek thought]: tautological thinking: primordial sense of phenomenology, prior to any distinction btwn theory/praxis > in philosophy there are only paths (Wege), in sciences only methods > to understand phenomenology: path that leads away to come before…, “lets that before which it is led show itself”: a phenomenology of the inapparent > now you can understand: there were no concepts for Greeks

HDG.DL.content: [on “language is the house of Being”] gives a hint (Wink) of nature of language > you’ve just said a freeing word (lösendes Wort) > Dann wäre der Wink der Grundzug des Wortes [the hint as the basic character of the word > but, p. 25 don’t let notion of hinting become guiding concept (Leitbegriff) (then we bundle up everything)] > Japaner senses (spüre) [trace] a kinship btwn phrase & a Japanese word [Koto ba, but at this point, remains unnamed]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.OHF.content: for Heidegger, hermeneutics (in connection [Anschluss] w/ its original meaning): definite unity in the actualizing (bestimmte Einheit des Vollzugs) of ermēneuein (communication), i.e. of the interpreting (Auslegens) of facticity: encountering, seeing, concept bringing

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: for Heidegger, hermeneutics (in connection [Anschluss] w/ its original meaning): definite unity in the actualizing (bestimmte Einheit des Vollzugs) of ermēneuein (communication), i.e. of the interpreting (Auslegens) of facticity: encountering, seeing, concept bringing

HDG.OHF.content: a concept points to a forehaving/foreconception (Vorgriff), transports us to a fundamental experience, calls for a how of addressing (Ansprechens)/interrogating: transports (versetzt) us into the being-there of our Dasein (interpretation & worry [Bekümerung]) > fundamental concepts (Grundbegriffe) not later additions to Dasein, sondern vor-tragen (but carry forward, ex-press), grab/point Dasein in their way [auto-affection?]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: a concept points to a forehaving/foreconception (Vorgriff), transports us to a fundamental experience, calls for a how of addressing (Ansprechens)/interrogating: transports (versetzt) us into the being-there of our Dasein (interpretation & worry [Bekümerung]) > fundamental concepts (Grundbegriffe) not later additions to Dasein, sondern vor-tragen (but carry forward, ex-press), grab/point Dasein in their way [auto-affection?]

HDG.OHF.content: [history of the concept of “Man”] 1) living being endowed w/ reason (via Aristotle) 2) person or personhood (Christian explication guided by Revelation in Old Testament) > but logos never meant “reason” for Aristotle, but discourse (Rede), conversation (Gespräch): man as a being that has its world in mode (Weise) of something addressed (der Angesprochenen) [man in language]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [history of the concept of “Man”] 1) living being endowed w/ reason (via Aristotle) 2) person or personhood (Christian explication guided by Revelation in Old Testament) > but logos never meant “reason” for Aristotle, but discourse (Rede), conversation (Gespräch): man as a being that has its world in mode (Weise) of something addressed (der Angesprochenen) [man in language]

HDG.OHF.content: [series of historical quotes on (Christian) concept of “Man” (Paul, Tatian, Augustine, Aquinas, Zwingli, Calvin, Scheler)] Scheler: man is intention/gesture of transcendence itself, gateway for grace, theo-morphism, an X which is finite/living image of God [Heidegger proclaims: “clear enough: a panorama! a picture, a story (Roman)!”] > Scheler ruins both theology/philosophy: a method of looking away (Hinwegsehens) from facticity

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [series of historical quotes on (Christian) concept of “Man” (Paul, Tatian, Augustine, Aquinas, Zwingli, Calvin, Scheler)] Scheler: man is intention/gesture of transcendence itself, gateway for grace, theo-morphism, an X which is finite/living image of God [Heidegger proclaims: “clear enough: a panorama! a picture, a story (Roman)!”] > Scheler ruins both theology/philosophy: a method of looking away (Hinwegsehens) from facticity

HDG.OHF.content: in its traditional categorial forms (Prägungen) [stamps], concept man fundamentally obstructs view to facticity
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: in its traditional categorial forms (Prägungen) [stamps], concept man fundamentally obstructs view to facticity

HDG.OHF.content: defined as Dasein’s own, facticity contains nothing of “ego,” person, “ego-pole,” Aktzentrum ——initial approach (ersten Ansetzen) to “object” of hermeneutical explication must hold fast (halten) to directive (Weisung) co-given in advance in concept of facticity, the possible direction of filling it out (mögliche Erfüllungsrichtung)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: defined as Dasein’s own, facticity contains nothing of “ego,” person, “ego-pole,” Aktzentrum ——initial approach (ersten Ansetzen) to “object” of hermeneutical explication must hold fast (halten) to directive (Weisung) co-given in advance in concept of facticity, the possible direction of filling it out (mögliche Erfüllungsrichtung)

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

HDG.OHF.content: [bracketing of phenomenology—deconstruction of Heidegger’s destruction?] Husserl’s phenomenology: “where are the objects about which logic speaks and how are they for it?” > Brentano characterized consciousness as intentionality, a concept that arose in Middle Ages, though it had narrower meaning then: volitional being-out-for-something and going-toward-it (das willentliche Aussein auf etwas) (orexis)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [bracketing of phenomenology—deconstruction of Heidegger’s destruction?] Husserl’s phenomenology: “where are the objects about which logic speaks and how are they for it?” > Brentano characterized consciousness as intentionality, a concept that arose in Middle Ages, though it had narrower meaning then: volitional being-out-for-something and going-toward-it (das willentliche Aussein auf etwas) (orexis)
